Hey everyone, I am super new to using Recipes in conjunction with Plots and am having trouble with an example from RecipesBase.jl. Here is the example code:

```using RecipesBase

struct T end

@recipe function plot(::T, n = 1; customcolor = :green)
    markershape --> :auto        # if markershape is unset, make it :auto
    markercolor :=  customcolor  # force markercolor to be customcolor
    xrotation   --> 45           # if xrotation is unset, make it 45
    zrotation   --> 90           # if zrotation is unset, make it 90
    rand(10,n)                   # return the arguments (input data) for the next recipe
end

using Plots
gr()

plot(T(), 5; customcolor = :black, shape=:c)
png("test.png")```
I am trying to change the background color of this plot to a different color like blue to learn how to use the `@recipe` macro. However, I keep getting an error that I am not sure how to address when I specify the background color as follows:

```@recipe function plot(::T, n = 1; customcolor = :green)
    markershape --> :auto        # if markershape is unset, make it :auto
    markercolor :=  customcolor  # force markercolor to be customcolor
    xrotation   --> 45           # if xrotation is unset, make it 45
    zrotation   --> 90           # if zrotation is unset, make it 90
    rand(10,n)                   # return the arguments (input data) for the next recipe
    background_color := :red
end```

Oh strange. It is dependent on where I put the attribute. This works:

```@recipe function plot(::T, n = 1; customcolor = :green)
    markershape --> :auto        # if markershape is unset, make it :auto
    background_color := :red
    markercolor := customcolor  # force markercolor to be customcolor
    xrotation --> 45           # if xrotation is unset, make it 45
    zrotation --> 90           # if zrotation is unset, make it 90
    rand(10, n)                   # return the arguments (input data) for the next recipe
end```
